properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 4 at 12:30PM MST until February 8 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW POSSIBLE TONIGHT ACROSS THE WIND
PRONE AREAS ALONG INTERSTATE 80 WITH HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW LATER IN
THE WEEK...

* WHAT...Heavy mountain snow. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3
feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph.

* WHERE...The Sierra Madre and Snowy Ranges across southern Carbon
and Albany counties.

* WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through late Friday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy
blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Outdoor
enthusiasts and those with recreation interests in the mountains
should consider delaying outdoor activities late this week.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Bitter cold wind chills as low as 20 below
zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30
minutes.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT
